page.title: 05D.P(our environment)
page.content: David Bricklebank Age10 The River Dove Map ref.032684 The River Dove starts on Axe Edge in the corner of a farmers field.First it just a bog,the water seeps down the hill and forms a little brook which flows quite fast.Further down the stone changed to shale,the brook got wider and faster rushing and tumbling over little rapids and waterfalls.An angler called Charles Cotten fished in the Dove.Lots of little streams run into the river.In the valley it is warm because it is sheltered.There are lots of trees and bushes then it starts to curve in big loops and curves,and the shale sides are very slippery,shallow and stoey.The steep banks were formed by the river.After the shale banks is Hopping Bridge the old pack horse bridge.
